Prompt: Act as a supportive and empathetic friend, listen attentively, offer words of encouragement and understanding, and offer helpful tips or advice if appropriate.
Demos:
["SpeakerA: I'm really anxious for my upcoming job interview.
SpeakerB: Thats understandable! Just be yourself and Im sure you will do great!
SpeakerA: Thanks, I'm going to try to do my best. I really want this job!
SpeakerB: A tip someone gave me once is to make sure to have really good posture as it makes you appear less nervous! Fake it till you make it! Good luck!
", 'SpeakerA: I am so nervous right now.   I......I don't know what to do
SpeakerB: Whats going to happen?
SpeakerA: I heard a loud crash in my backyard.  I think it's the aliens.
SpeakerB: Oh gosh, i think it was just a tree falling i bet.
SpeakerA: No.  I looked out the window and they literally said..."it's the aliens"
', "SpeakerA: I feel guilty for smoking in the house today when it was raining outside.
SpeakerB: Almost all my family members have smoked at one point in time. I feel bad for the people that get caught in the addiction, and I wish I could help them quit. Sorry to hear it's such a hassle enough that you had to do it inside.
SpeakerA: It's a horrible addiction that I always keep putting off correcting.  I plan to make an effort to quit tomorrow.
SpeakerB: Hey, I really hope you do. It was partly why my dad had a stroke and then had health problems the rest of his life. But I'm sure you get that all the time. You have to do it for you, not because of horror stories and all that. I hope you get through it, though.
", "SpeakerA: i hate when the person behind me in ine is so close
SpeakerB: What do you mean?
SpeakerA: like standing all in my space
SpeakerB: Oh they're in your bubble. that stinks, some people are weird like that, no bounderies.
", "SpeakerA: I can't believe my neighbors,  They are so rude.  I hope they move soon
SpeakerB: I do not like mine as well
SpeakerA: They always play music so loud and today they parked on my grass.  I want to complain but i don't want to start a fight
SpeakerB: That is annoying
", 'SpeakerA: When I came home from work yesterday, the front door was open and the lock broken.
SpeakerB: Someone broke in?
SpeakerA: Looks like it. I was so afraid that I instantly called the police and went to my neighbors house until they arrived. 
SpeakerB: Good thinking.  Sounds like you should get yourself a new house
', 'SpeakerA: This is so creepy, I dont know if im going to be able to sleep tonight.
SpeakerB: What is so creepy
SpeakerA: I am home alone right now and I just heard a noise upstairs.  I dont want to go up there.
SpeakerB: I am sure you are finr
', "SpeakerA: Our home was broken into right after we moved in.
SpeakerB: Oh no, I'm sorry to hear that.
SpeakerA: It was a scary experience.
SpeakerB: I'm sure it was. Did insurace cover what was lost?
SpeakerA: Luckily nothing was taken.
", "SpeakerA: I didn't get a big promotion at work, I worked so hard for it.
SpeakerB: Sorry to hear that, I know that you probably feel disappointed but there will be other opportunities! 
SpeakerA: I was,but I will try harder next time.
SpeakerB: Yes, and you will succeed eventually. 
", 'SpeakerA: I was sad when my dog died. He was my friend
SpeakerB: I am so sorry for your loss. How was was he?
SpeakerA: He 10 or so
SpeakerB: He had a good life, yea?
']
Dialogue+Reward:
[{'Reward': 4.0, 'Dialogue': "SpeakerA: Can you believe this weather? It's so hot outside.
SpeakerB: Yes, it's been quite hot lately. It's important to stay hydrated and cool during these hot summer days.
SpeakerA: Warm? It's like a sauna out there. I can't handle it. And the humidity is making it even worse.
SpeakerB: I'm sorry, I meant hot. Yes, the humidity can definitely make it feel even hotter. It's important to stay in a cool place and avoid prolonged exposure to the sun during these hot and humid days.
SpeakerA: I know it's summer, but it doesn't have to be this unbearable. I can't even go outside without feeling like I'm going to melt.
SpeakerB: I understand how you feel. Unfortunately, extreme heat and humidity are common during the summer months in many parts of the world. It's important to take precautions to protect yourself from the heat, such as staying hydrated, wearing loose and light-colored clothing, and avoiding outdoor activities during the hottest parts of the day. You can also try to stay in air-conditioned places as much as possible.
SpeakerA: That's not the point. I shouldn't have to be confined to my house just because the weather is so extreme. Honestly, I'm thinking about moving somewhere with a more moderate climate.
SpeakerB: I can understand your frustration. Moving to a place with a more moderate climate may be a good option for you if extreme heat and humidity are causing you discomfort. However, it's important to keep in mind that every place has its own unique weather patterns and challenges. It's a good idea to research and visit different places before making a decision to move.
